I sustained over 1,200 worth of damage. I called the hotel staff and they indicated that there is a parking issue and to have my insurance call them. I have called the suggeted HR person repeatedly with no return phone call. Bottomline - the hotel parking cannot accomodate wide or longer vehicles and damage can be sustained. Problem is, once you are in, you are stuck. The parking is poorly designed and I would strongly caution travelers from parking at this hotel. AND you have to pay $20.00 to park!! AVOID!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandabuns
Reviews.Content: It's great place if you're looking for a hotel downtown of San Diego. Very clean and quiet. I loved the cookies and the view from our room. If you're a walker like me, I wouldn't recommend walking back to the hotel at night because there were a lot of creeps around the neighborhood when I walked back to the hotel from dinner. Other than that, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Doubletree with insane parking”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was selected as the two other Hilton properties in the area were sold out. The hotel is located in a pretty good but not amazing area. The staff were helpful. The parking here is seriously insane with incredibly narrow turns. Not sure why anyone in their right mind would design a garage like this. The rooms were pretty nice, very clean, and very spacious. The room would have been better with a flat screen TV. On another note, the printer was not working which was a pain for last minute business needs. Overall, I would once again try the other two Hilton properties before this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bobbert1312
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to see how close this hotel is to Little Italy and the Gaslamp District. A nice eight blocks walk downhill and you're in the middle of the action. The only minor issue is that the patio door did not block out all of the airport and freeway noises. But otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: fergie n
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with a lovely warm cookie and friendly staff, hardly a cue at check in time, we parked in the hotel car park wich was easy. the rooms were lovely, spaciuos, great views you are near the airport we were not woken once. there is a nice shopping centre close by and also lots of bars and resturants you also very close to mexico if you are wanting to drive there. fabulous rooftop pool and a must is san diego zoo great day out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for central location”
Reviews.Author: Morgan2010
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's price/location combination - was less than other downtown hotels. Rooms were excellent - outstanding even. Quality of employees was lacking - we asked about trolley tour and got little response (surprising for a popular tourist attraction). Asked for lunch recommendation and were told the 'best place in town is in the hotel'. So I would say do not expect much help - but if you want a place downtown, this a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “I was so happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Kwilkes
Reviews.Content: I have to say we totally enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. When we arrived everyone at the front desk was happy & helpful. We booked 3 rooms and they worked hard to give us the view and the rooms on the same floor. The rooms were exceptionally clean. We actually liked the walk down to the Gas Lamp district we didn't feel it was to far at all. So over all can't say one bad thing about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3.5 Star, Narrow parking and ramps”
Reviews.Author: Snakepudding
Reviews.Content: This hotel was presented as a 3.5 star but I would suggest this is an over-rating. Narrow parking spaces and ramps resulting in not being able to park a full sized import in a slot; if you drive a full size SUV you may want to avoid this parking garage. The front desk was helpful and friendly. One of the guest elevators seemed to be shut-off. We were offered a nice location 21st floor room. Our view was mostly south but some west view. I recommend avoiding rooms facing east or north because of the freeway noise and view. The room was very well cleaned but only had a NTSC analog TV which of course resulted in a somewhat truncated image. Kudos to the housekeeping staff. Wireless internet was free; could not connect to the wired/secure internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I was hoping”
Reviews.Author: MEL1103
Reviews.Content: I'm typically pretty happy with a Doubletree, but this one wasn't spectacular. My husband, who is very laid-back and isn't into frills made mentions of not liking this hotel. As many have said, the parking is very narrow, but it's fine to navigate, just takes an extra minute or two to get in and out. The rooms were okay, but there appeared to be some plumbing or pipe issues due to the LOUD bubbling noise that occurred after running any water in our room or the nearby rooms - which affected sleep quality. The location is close to Little Italy so that's nice if you're wanting to go there, but is a bit of a walk to get to the heart of downtown/Gaslamp so had to drive and pay for parking again to get down there. It was nice to have free Wifi that was pretty good. In general, just average, nothing too sketchy, but nothing too exciting either.

Reviews.Title: “Better Choices”
Reviews.Author: brentcarroll
Reviews.Content: This is my first review but as a Hilton Diamond Member (and spending a lot of time in Hilton branded hotels), I was compelled to write this. I have to say you can do better. In my opinion, this hotel is aged, poorly managed and not in that great of a location (too far from the Gaslamp District and too close to the highway). Nearly every hotel you visit you can find a flaw. And usually you take that in perspective with the overall experience. But this hotel, the flaws add up quick and the list is long. The other Doubletrees in the area are better in every regard. Oh, and I have to give a nod to the bed. All Doubletrees have great beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great View. Great Hotel. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Justthe2ofus23
Reviews.Content: After a 4 hour flight delay my husband and I landed in San Diego and were greeted by the hotel shuttle driver with a smile and a "welcome to San Diego". Upon check at the hotel we were then greeted by a friendly girl at the front desk who let us know that if we needed anything to let her know (big plus). We took a cab to the Gaslamp District for dinner and were amazed at the numer of restaurants. After a very filling dinner at Bella Luna we decided to walk back to our hotel. (we didnt realize that it was walking distance and taking a cab back wouldnt be necessary). The hotel is very clean and has an adequate gym that is located on the same floor as the pool. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom are not cramped. We had a spectacular view of the downtown area from our balcony. We had breakfast 2 mornings in a row and were pleased with the food quality and setting. The staff was friendly and made eye contact (which is important to the two of us). I recomend this hotel and city to all.

Reviews.Title: “The Doubletree Hotel downtown is a great hotel to stay at while on vaction.”
Reviews.Author: pms4109
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant, the room was clean, the pool area was clean and well stocked with towels. Roomservice was on time (food was hot and tasty). Downtown loaction is great and the staff was knowleage with directions.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY”
Reviews.Author: nestofox
Reviews.Content: Very old building made feel unconfortable, parking is 20 dollars and very narrow hard to enter and exit, the staff did not want to make my AAA discount and charged me some other stupid fees, one tub was clogged, the place made me feel I just gave my money away. I will never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Needs An Attitude Adjustment”
Reviews.Author: boomerchick244
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this hotel over the weekend for our 4th wedding anniversary. We live in San Diego and since we usually go out-of-town to celebrate, this year we wanted to enjoy a "staycation" in America's finest city. Although we got a reasonable deal, our stay was nothing less than a nightmare. We stayed 2 nights, and both nights we got NO sleep. On both sides of our room, we dealt with obnoxious, loud, annoying guests ALL night long. On both nights, we had to contact management and request security to come up. They did nothing-- the noise continued all night. The next day, my husband requested that our rooms be switched if the obnoxious guests were not going to check out by noon. He communicated our frustration and the front desk girl told him that we had "only called once." By the way, as someone who works in the hospitality industry, I would encourage the management to send each employee of this hotel to a customer-service training course. Each person that we talked to was extremely un-personable, no personality, energy, excitement or passion for their job. When we checked out, the girl at the front desk didn't even note that we hadn't paid for parking (we had to bring it up) or ask how our (horrible) stay was. The one redeeming part of this trip was the Doubletree cookie. But moving forward, this trip officially sealed the deal: we will NEVER return to a Doubletree, especially this one, and we will tell our friends and family that visit and live in this town to avoid it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with super comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: FullCode
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about this hotel based on other reviews I read. I "won" this hotel on Priceline for a great price. My husband and I were very happy with our stay. I requested a city view to avoid extra noise (we had our toddler with us). The front desk staff worked on our request for a couple minutes using the computer and were able to get the room for us. They were always kind and helpful when we saw them. The housekeepers were also very friendly. The king size bed was so comfortable!!! Plenty of pillows to choose from as well. The room was very clean. Bathrooms were fine except for a small sink, no fan and no makeup mirror. The toilet did make some strange noises at times but was not a nuisance and did not wake us up. Old TV but it worked so we can't really complain. The parking garage did have some tight turns but it is not as bad as most people mentioned in prior reviews. You just need to drive slowly around the turns. We drove a mid-size car and a small SUV without trouble. Located just off the freeway, near the airport and central to many tourist attractions. We enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennmelzer
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed this hotel. Convenient location, great views, and nice, clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: mmvinnyt
Reviews.Content: I prefer staying in hotels with good location. This hotel was about 1 mile away from downtown SD (Horton Plaza area), and one block away from Little Italy close to shops and restaurants. So I just stayed here, parked my car (since I paid $20/night for it), and walked to wherever we needed to go. Warning: if you walk to downtown at night down Front St., you will pass a jail and homeless people sleeping on the sidewalk. We didn't mind it much though. Since I booked this on Hotwire, they gave me a room facing the 5 freeway, which can be pretty loud. I'm not sure if I have to pay more for the view of downtown. As for the hotel itself, the staff was ok, the cookies were delicious, the rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, and the shower was pretty strong. My only gripe besides the noise emanating from the freeway was the tiny sink. I would stay here again because of the location, and the price was a lot more accommodating than actually staying in the Gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location and acceptable service”
Reviews.Author: brhea
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to just get in and out of San Diego, the Doubletree downtown is worth considering. The location is great in that it's just a 10-15 minute walk from the water and there are some nice coffee houses and shops very nearby in the Little Italy Historic District. We received decent service but nothing exemplary or outstanding. The air conditioner in our room was making some awful noises through the night (just typical maintenance issue that could happen anywhere, I suppose) and the staff was sympathetic when we reported, but not terribly apologetic. Truly, just an average all-around stay. So, if this hotel is in your budget, I would recommend it and would imagine that you'll be just fine. However, if it's on the lower-range of what you want to spend and you're accustomed to exceptional service, or if you're going to spend more than you normally do and are hoping for a really nice stay, in either case I think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: aaebert67
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my experience at this hotel, I would definitely go back. Was in SD for two days for a meeting, which we had at the hotel. They catered our lunches, dinners and snacks. It was like every time we were getting hungry, someone was there with food for us. We got to have lunch out by the pool, which is beautiful and offers great views of the city. I could have stayed there for the entire day. The room was very neat and clean, well stocked. They also gave us cookies when we checked in, and they were delicious. The best part was the bed- it was large, soft, and clean. There were also about a half dozen pillows on the bed, which made it amazing. The hotel is next to the airport, which you would think would be a problem, but it was not for me. I am a very light sleeper, and the slightest noise will keep me up all night. I had no problems at the Doubletree, even with airplanes flying by my window every ten minutes. I have stayed at the Holiday Inn directly across the street, and would absolutely choose the Double Tree over it. Doubletree is a little more expensive, but just barely, and it is well worth the extra 10 or 20 dollars. Only real problem- the shuttle took an hour to come get me at the airport. It was supposed to be running out to the airport every 15 minutes or so. When I called the staff after waiting half an hour, a woman ( who barely spoke English) curtly told me that it would be there shortly. Called again 20 minutes later, same woman picks up, gives me same answer. Called yet again 10 minutes later, different woman picks up, apologizes for my inconvenience, and sends the shuttle immediately. And now you know everything you need to know about the Double Tree!

Reviews.Title: “nightmarish parking ramp”
Reviews.Author: ypwalhca701
Reviews.Content: I've driven from Nice, France to Monte Carlo, a couple of times in and outside of London, never was I so freaked out while maneuvering our car at 90 degree turn up on this concrete walled ramps to find a parking space. I saw plenty of scuff marks on the wall, indicating many guests would go home not only with frayed nerve, but also with scratched bumpers. Then on Labor day, early morning, we were waken by fire alarm, not once we saw any hotel staff to assist us, or to tell us what to do. When the strobe lights began flashing, we along with other guests walked down 14 flight of stairs, made it out to the streets. saw a couple of fire engines, and fire fighters. They seemed so calm, then we heard "false alarm". We went back to the lobby, this female staff stood behind the counter, did not say anything to us. When I asked, she confirmed that it was false alarm, apologized. It was 2 in the morning, we were too tired to make any fuss. We got madder once we made home. We felt that the management staff did not make any effort to direct the guests, offered no information, showed absolutely no feelings toward us, us guests who experienced such an inconvenience. When I inquired about perhaps a free breakfast for the guests, the reply was "it was not the hotel's fault". We feel that the hotel staff was ill-prepared for such an emergency. What if there were a fire in the middle of night, I have no confidence that the hotel staff knew what to do. The room is nice enough, like most hotel rooms, too bad they don't have flat screen TV, and there were not towel racks in the bathroom. The hotel is very close to Little Italy, that we walked to have dinner, then breakfast the next morning (after our fire alarm incident). It's about a mile to the GasLamp area, we walked over there, but took taxi back to the hotel. We have no desire to drive our car up and down the claustrophobic ramps, only once when we drove to the shopping mall, and last time when we were leaving the hotel. I hope we'll never "win" to stay here thru Priceline, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but not up to DoubleTree Standards”
Reviews.Author: Busy-Mom-of-1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending three nights over Labor Day weekend. First I did get a really good price through Priceline. Prior to arrival I called to request two beds and a downtown view and was told my request would be noted. Upon arrival I was informed no such request was in the system. They were able to give a room with two beds; however I did not get the downtown view and was on the airport side of the building. This side of the building included noise from the airport and the Highway. Although loud, was tolerable. The room itself was standard DoubleTree, although the room wasn't visually dirty, walking on the carpet my feet felt dirty. I did like the fact that the coffee maker was outside of the bathroom on it's own table. The room did have an older tube TV and not a flatscreen (not a big deal - it's a tv) We did use the pool two days. They had towels available for pool use and the bartender was there both days. The second day we went out the chairs were all being used so didn't get to lay around. Previous posters comments on the parking. We drove a full size Yukon and the only issue was in exiting the underground garage. We had to pull up and back twice to get it lined up to exit as it was a 90 degree tight turn. Other than that parking is typical for an older underground parking garage. The location was close enough that we walked to Little Italy and down to the water front. The GasLamp district was too far to walk for me. Unless you want to eat at the hotel restaurant Little Italy is the closest place. I believe this hotel is used primarily for airline employees for overnight stays as I constantly saw them coming in and out. Also for people without vehicles, probably people traveling and not wanting to rent a car as the hotel garage was never full but it seemed the hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Good Service, Noisy Location”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgentleman
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotel Downtown is in a location near the flight path to the city airport and close to a freeway making the room to be noisy. The restaurant in the hotel is comfortable, cozy, and beautifully decorated, but a little pricy for the area. The service and bar staff were accomodating and great conversationalists. The pool/spa area is very nice, however, the downside is that they did not have the pool bar open on Sunday when there were many adults soaking the sun and enjoying the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location and nothing fancy!”
Reviews.Author: skress1
Reviews.Content: The location was less than what we expected. The hotel is situated on the backside of the downtown area next to the highway. Any public transportation is at least a 5-6 block walk. Plus the hotel charges for parking ($20/day). On the upside, the hotel is very close to Little Italy and some great places to eat! Hotel service was not friendly and the hotel provides very little in terms of accomodations (small pool, bar, lobby). Overall, we got a decent price on the room for an average san diego hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever happened to service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pat46450
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we were informed that breakfast was not included, this despite a printed confirmation stating it was. No attempt was made by the staff to resolve this obvious oversight,they seemed to feel totally put off that we would ask

Reviews.Title: “Not well located - Without any character”
Reviews.Author: French-Doctor
Reviews.Content: Not a very interesting hotel. Some rooms are located just above the highway and the noise was so important that a collegue obtained to change her room. I cannot understand why some others customers do mention a "good location" since you are at 15 min walk from the city center with highly climbing streets...The rooms are correct but nothing more. You need to ask if you want to have shampoo in the bathroom (forgotten every morning or so). The breakfast is poor and is spent in an ugly space. The staff is not educated. We are clearly very far from the European standards...

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Location-Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Niece on a trip to Southern California It was nice to stay in San Diego as we lived here 25 years ago. Some things are the same many things have changed og Course.All in all a nice return to memories

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel w/Friendly Staff in an OK Location”
Reviews.Author: katskills
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip and found the room to be clean, modernly decorated, and in a decent location close to little Italy (about 2 blocks away) and 10 minute drive from Gaslamp Quarter. For a Doubletree, we were expecting a little bit more, but there was nothing really special about it. We were surprised that the TV was a 27" tube TV. The front desk staff was friendly and courteous; they provided good recommendations of places to eat and things to do. They also provided us with their heavenly signature chocolate cookies, the best ever! Self parking ran $20 which I think is a bit much for doing it yourself, but looking at other hotels close by, this was about the average running price. You definitely need a car to explore some of the highlights of San Diego which is why I would recommend a hotel closer to the desired attraction.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great city...”
Reviews.Author: 121star
Reviews.Content: the hotel was easy to find since it's RIGHT off the freeway. it's a 15-20 minute walk to gaslamp distrinct where all the fun shops and restaurants are. petco park is a short bus ride. the hotel itself was very nice, but overnight parking was expensive ($20!).

Reviews.Title: “Poor in Many Ways”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesRaphaelhom
Reviews.Content: Overall - the hotel is OK - altho I would definitely NOT stay here again for the following reasons: 1. $20 / night parking fee 2. rooms not very clean 3. kleenex boxes are recycled - in other words - they have been previously opened and stuffed with kleenex - god only knows who's hands stuffed the kleenex in the box. The previous box had 2 different colors of kleenex in it. I had to specifically request a box that has not been previously opened. 4. I was parking my car and watched the maid service make an extra bed in the garage area, allowing the sheets they used to drag on the garage floor. 5. Sliding glass doors in the rooms do not seal so you can clearly hear the noise from the street. I checked 3 different rooms and they were all the same. Shame on the hotel -- time to upgrade these sliding glass doors or at least spend some money to put a new sealer strip on them. I have seen this same problem at even some higher end hotels. I don't get it. Really old windows with no seal at all??? What's with that? Nice conference room, and nice cookies at check in and also very nice check in person allowing me to check out a few rooms to find the one that was quiet - but none were. Also the operator was rude when I called to explain the neighbors in the next were really loud. She was patronizing. Again - overall, not too bad an experience - just a few glitches - didn't sleep much because of the sound through the sliding glass door.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacVol
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in February. The hotel is on the fringe of downtown, closer to the airport. Ditto to all the concerns voiced about the narrow lanes in the parking garage. The people are friendly here--bar and breakfast service are very prompt. I did not get my cookies when I checked in--that is my single biggest complaint. Room was quiet, as I faced away from the airport towards the bay/downtown. Overall, this is a good hotel (not necessarily great by any stretch) and I would willingly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well overpriced”
Reviews.Author: KTatBT
Reviews.Content: Front Street freeway off ramp ends right at the hotel great for giving directions not so good for sleeping like wise for the airport fly way. Be sure to get an even numbered room for a harbor/city light view. We were checked into a dirty room, the pipes made noise, the shower was a hand held and it did not hold its position, in room coffee maker did not work, breakfast service staff SLOWWWW, web site states .5miles to city center???but the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, low price.”
Reviews.Author: tuslac
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel when in San Diego. If you pre-pay at hilton.com you can usually get it for $119 or less, which is much better than any of the similar quality hotels downtown. Rooms are large and clean. I usually ask for room facing south to downtown and the bay. Parking is $20 a night so I try to park in the streets and get out before you have to pay the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: Picked up this hotel for Saturday night on Priceline, and got it for $57/night + tax... not bad for the Saturday night after Thanksgiving. The hotel was fantastic... check in was great and we got two free cookies. The rooms were very nice. Plenty of street parking since they don't check the meters on Sunday. I'm not sure how much parking is otherwise. My only gripe was that they haven't upgraded their TV's to plasmas or LCD's, yet. Other than that, I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night. The room was quiet and clean. The beds were great, the location was perfect. Close to the airport and downtown. If I had to mention a negative it would be the parking garage. DO NOT RENT A LUXURY CAR AND TRY TO PARK IN THIS GARAGE. We had an Impala (full size car) and it was a chore to get in and out . My wife assured me that if I had not been with her, she would have gone to the front desk and had them move it through the maze.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, Affordable and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Simpson_eh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in convenient location for downtown, old town and airport. Rooms clean, well serviced and above average size. The pool area was a great sun trap with a fantastic view of the bay. Well stocked bar and nice food with mostly good service. The $20 self-park seems steep but that seems to be the average wherever you go in SD! It's realistically a 15-20 minute stroll to 5th (Gaslamp) but its a nice walk and only around $5 in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Threekidfamily
Reviews.Content: Our rate was around $100/night for 2 nights. We were on the top floor (22nd) looking towards the airport. The room was very nice and comfortable. The parking is extra and is in a very narrow garage. We checked in late and went to eat downstairs where there is a restaurant. It was closed but the bartender said the kitchen was still open and we could order anything from him. He was very friendly and accomodating and we enjoyed our meal.I probably wouldnt stay here if on a regular vacation but for business it is probably perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree San Diego Downtown for one night before heading out to another location for the rest of our trip. We arrived around 10:30pm. The parking garage is small, but otherwise acceptable and connected directly to the hotel. Since it was late we did not look for street parking and just paid the $20 for the night. Upon entering the lobby, the it small but modern and welcoming. The manager checked us in as the clerk was working with someone else. He did forget to give us our credit card back but the clerk called quickly to let us know. We also got the traditional Doubletree cookies on check in. Our room was on the 21st floor and was relatively large and well appointed. They room seemed to be recently remodeled. There was a balcony overlooking downtown San Diego. I was surprised that they still had an old 27" CRT TV in the room. Bathroom was big enough and had a nice selection of Neutrogena Toiletries. The room was rather noisy. You could hear doors slamming in the hallway, plumbing gurgling, and most noticeably lots of traffic and city noise given we were on the 21st floor. It was fine for a night but would probably wear on you after that. Since I am a Hhonors Diamond member, we were given a free full breakfast buffet in the dining room downstairs. It was hearty and had many selections. The wait staff was very helpful and overall we were pleased. The $16 price per person would have a bit hefty. Upon arrival there was a note saying the pool was closed for a week. Given we just booked the day before on the Hilton site, that should have been noted, but since we were just overnight it was no problem for us. We did not get the opportunity to check out the neighborhood nor exercise room as we were moving to an Old Town area hotel that morning, but there does not seem to be much in the vicinity in regards to tourist activities.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth $100/night.”
Reviews.Author: SDL_Resident
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay at the Doubletree mainly because it was close to the airport and only $100/night. The complimentary shuttle picked us up from the airport and we were checked in fairly quickly amongst several flight attendants. The front desk was very professional and polite. The room we were given was on the 19th floor facing the freeway and while we weren't able to hear the airport noise from our room, we were able to hear the freeway traffic, even with the door closed. My boyfriend called the front desk and asked to be moved to a different room that faced the other direction. The front desk happily changed our room and met us at the new room with the new keys. Our new room was much quieter and had a better view of the pool and downtown as opposed to the freeway. The room itself was pretty big with a decent sized bathroom. I'd have to say the bed was probably the best part about the whole stay. It was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in at a hotel. We only stayed for one night since we headed up to Carlsbad the next day but I think the room and the service was definitely worth the $100 we spent for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianOCChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at The Doubletree at the end of February and found it to be great. It's more like a small European Boutique hotel than part of a big chain. Our room on the 8th floor was clean and well appointed. We loved the location in Little Italy. You can walk to many great restaurants and shops. The trains (Coaster and Trolley) were a short walk away and can take you as far north as Carlsbad and Mexico to the south. The Gaslamp district is a 7 minute walk away. Despite it's location near the freeway and airport, it was very quiet. The pool deck is excellent. Again, very clean. The hotel staff is friendly and seemed very happy to be there. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at Double Tree will consider other options next time”
Reviews.Author: shaniz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the second week of February for a 5 day conference. Called the hotel upon arriving at the airport and waited about 15 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. Rooms are average with older furnishings. The water in the bathroom did not get really hot and would water hammer while taking a shower. I am sure the neighboring rooms liked it. The climate control in the room did not work. Luckily it was cool enough outside I could open a window. Relatively close to gas lamp district and little Italy. About a 15 minute walk down to the harbor. Desk staff was not too friendsly. DId not use the fitness center or pool. There are a lot of hotel options in this area and will definitely consider those when staying in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, did not love it”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: If you can get it for a decent price, this is a good pick if you are looking for something in the Downtown San Diego area. It is next to the litte Italy area and relatively close to the Harbour and Gaslamp Quarter. The rooms are standard hotel rooms, were clean and seemed to be relatively well maintained. That said, housekeeping personel are using a strongly scented cleaning agent throughout the hotel to mask the hotel's "maturity". Most rooms have a balcony. My room was facing south or soutwest so I had a nice overview of the Downtown area as well as a limited view of the harbour/ocean. Internet is free at this property which is nice. A very strong positive is the hotel staff: very friendly and efficient. The hotel is within walking distance to the Little Italy trolley station if you decide to use public transit while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wmlv
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews and was not sure about this hotel. I did learn from the reviews to request a south facing room. They accommodated me nicely. We were on the 18th floor with a great view of the lights in the city. All the hotels in downtown San Diego are a few blocks from the airport so expect some noise from landing aircraft. That is the price you pay for staying downtown. The pros out way the cons. We found the room to be very clean and comfortable and well appointed even with Neutrogena bath products. Free wifi is a plus. Yes the parking is narrow and expensive, but I have been in worse. The closer you get to the harbor, the more the parking will cost you. Great freeway access to visit the local attractions. The little Italy section of town is only 4 blocks down the street toward the harbor with fabulous dining options. And the harbor is only another 4 blocks past that. Overall it is a great place to stay. If I paid over $200 a night I would expect more. Find it in the $100 to $150 range it beats a lot of other places downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Alright Hotel. Beware. Do NOT expect anything to be free!”
Reviews.Author: luvforever
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the Doubletree hotel in Downtown San Diego. This is my first stay in San Diego. I did some research, read some alarming reviews about the noises, still, I decided to book here because of the location. First of all, the CSR that I called to book the hotel had some attitude problem when I made a request such as upgrading from double twins bed to king bed and etc. Then I was told to enroll in HH account which she gave me an account number but later I found out that the account isn't active so I would get no credit for my stay. Needless to say that CSR was a [--] with an attitude problem. When I came to the hotel, I got my room and everything was ok. The noise from the AC isn't that bad, it does sound like somebody opens your door when it turns on. Anyway, another problem with this hotel is the attitude of the waiters at the Ariana restaurant. The waiters expect you to tip them for everything, even "take out / togo" orders. They seem to think that they get paid for standing there and doing nothing. If they have to ring up your order, you are expected to give them a BIG TIP, $2 for togo tip isn't good enough. They won't even look at you the next time they see you if you don't give them TIPs. How pathetic. I don't really understand how the waiters expect to get tip for bringing food from the kitchen to outside doing no extra service that deserving of tip. This attitude problem from the waiters has to change. Especially, the food from the hotel is so horrible and expensive. For the same price, you can go out and buy the same food at half price that the hotel charges. Another thing about this hotel is the narrow parking garage. It is literally NARROW so watch out your speed and make sure you drive very slow in there. The room overall is decent, NOT super clean or new., just standard. Overall I would give a C = 3 stars for everything about this hotel. However, they charges a little over price I believe they charge the price of a 4-star hotel when they are only about 3-star hotel. Tha'ts my honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get a discount”
Reviews.Author: cpdad
Reviews.Content: I had a recent weekend stay, after getting this property on Priceline. The asking price (rack rate) was $209, which seems excessive to me given the location and facilities of this hotel. The Priceline rate was considerably less and made for a good value stay. So, if you can get a discount, this would be a good place to stay. The hotel has been recently redecorated and the guest rooms are attractively furnished as are the bathrooms. Beds have comfortable pillow-top mattresses. A small observation: the in-room coffee maker is unlike any other I have seen in hotel rooms, and I liked it. I generally avoid using hotel coffee makers because the brown liquid that they dispense is not worth drinking, at least not for my tastes. But this is not the case at the Doubletree; the Wolfgang Puck-branded coffee and the unique style coffee maker made for a decent cup of coffee. I had read about the noise problem here on Tripadvisor, so I requested, and was given, a room facing south, away from the airport & highway. Noise was not an issue for us. We particularly liked the balcony. It is rare to have an urban hotel room with windows that open let alone a balcony. This balcony was greatly appreciated and added value to my stay. In-room Wi-Fi access is free to guests. As others have noted, they will provide you with warm cookies at check-in, and they will be happy to give you additional cookies on other nights if it appears that they will have "extras". The location is on the outskirts of downtown, which may not appeal to some travelers, but I came to prefer this location because it made the hotel more accessible. On the weekend, I was able to park on the street and avoid the $20/night garage fee. This might not have been possible at a downtown property. It's a subtle point, but It seems fair to say that the Doubletree has hotel facilities but with an easy "motel-style" access. I got over my initial apprehension about not being in the downtown core, and came to prefer this peripheral location in the "Little Italy" neighborhood. It was interesting to read a previous poster's comment about the mechanical noise made by the air conditioning sytem when it turns on or off - we experienced the same noise, and it was indeed annoying. The blowing air was audible, but not a problem. There was something wrong with the starting/stopping of the forced air that resulted in that banging noise. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again, but not for over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Improving, But a Way To Go Yet.”
Reviews.Author: venturagm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubltree during my Naval retirement ceremony. My friend checked in as I went on some errands. Our initial room was facing North towards the highway and flight path. My friend was so stunned by the noise when he entered the room that he thought the windows were open. They weren't. We were moved to a room facing south and the noise issue was considerably better. The hotel still needs to invest in modern windows and patio doors to provide the quiet and peace one would expect of a hotel in this price range. The interior decor of the room was pleasant, but there are some basic maintenance issues that are still in dire need of attention, namely plumbing and electrical. The diverter in the shower was so bad that you had to wrench the handle to stop the flow of water. Even then, the water would start to drip after a while. I'm sure the city of San Diego doesn't appreciate the wasted water. There were two light fixtures that did not work and one outlet that wouldn't work either. I know they have been doing a lot of work to this hotel, but they still have a way to go before they will truly meet the expectations most of us have of a Doubletree Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Bedbugs, fleas in beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: tee111
Reviews.Content: We can only advise to stay far away from this hotel! Their hygiene standards are dismal, the attitude of their staff shocking. My husband was on business travel and woke up in the middle of the night - there were bedbugs and fleas and mites in his bed, dozens! He immediately went to the reception and and showed them the bed. No apologies. They acted as if they were doing him a tremendous favor by giving him another room in the middle of the night. In the morning the hotel management did not apologize either, but had the gall to offer a 10% discount on his next stay in their overpriced bug infested hotel! Unbelievable. We have traveled all over the world and never encountered anything like this!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina1234
Reviews.Content: Wow, I have never been bothered by noise in a hotel before and I am a world traveler. From the planes taking off every few minutes to the sirens on the highway those things can't be changed I understand. However the noise from the pipes is horrible and wakes you up every time someone sends water down the sink from a room on top of yours. There is no ventilation in the bathroom so those of us staying with someone have to well..avoid the restroom for a while after the oner person goes. Then there is the hotel shuttle back-up noise. You can hear it on the 16th floor even!!! Every time one of their many shuttles backs up. Also for 3 hours from midnight to 3 AM someones alarm clock would not shut off. We complained to the front desk and they really seemed like they could care less; especially since it took them 15 rings to pick up the phone! They said they would send security by but there wasn't alot they could do. I tried to sleep with a pillow covering my ears. Today they are moving us to a room on the other side of the hotel. (Upon my request) I will keep you updated. Also the pool has been closed since yesterday. The nice thing about the hotel is that it is close to little Italy. I highly reccommend Cafe Zuccherro a couple blocks down from the hotel. They have the best lasagna I have ever had... also an incredible bakery inside. (and I am a chef back home) Like everyone says the beds are very comfortable; however if you can't get to sleep because of the noise... what's the point!!!! Book your room somewhere else. We went by the Hard Rock hotel last night in the Gaslamp quarter. It is amazing inside, and a perfect location. I wish we would have booked there. Well I better go upstairs to pack up everything so I can change rooms. What a pain!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but beware of parking”
Reviews.Author: jerryrs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via hotwire but was not informed that overnight parking entailed an additional $20 per nite fee. To make matters worse parking was very challenging in their very tight garage. The entrance ramp is extremely narrow which made it difficult for me to navigate using a mid size rental car I wasn't all too familiar with. I would think for $20 a night a valet would have at least parked the car for me. Other than that the hotel is very comfortable. Pool area is nice but appears to be undergoing renovation. Very nice fitness center. Location is excellent being just a few minutes from the gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: patty307LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Priceline, I must say I was kind of scared when I found out this was the one we got, but heck for $95 a night it was great. When we arrived we were nicely greated by the desk attendant, she gave us a room on the side opposite to the freeway and it was great. We could only hear the the train at night, but it was not so bad, by the second night we had blocked out the noice completely. The room was very clean and a very nice room. Loved that we were so close to the freeway and Little Italy. Try Fillippi's it was good food at a very reasonable price. We also went to Old town, but the food was not that great, try Bread and Cie, 2 exits from the hotel on the 5 North. Also try the Dinner cruise on Hornblower, the hotel has a 2 for 1 coupon in the back of the maps they give you. The wait at Richard Walker's is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hennypenny10
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Doubletree. The hotel shuttle was fast and easy, just call when you land and they will be there within minutes. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. If you stay on the side by the freeway the noise could be a problem. We could hear both the sounds of the freeway and the planes landing. At night with the AC on the noise didn't bother us at all and it was fun to watch the planes landing during the day. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the Gasslamp and about 5 minutes from Little Italy and the Center City trolley station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: psmoove
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel. 3 miles to Balboa Park/San Diego Zoo, and very modern furnishings and contemporary lobby. We stayed on the 19th floor and our views of the harbor were fantastic. Used the pool on the 5th floor and while it was a smallish pool, it was nice and warm and great views of downtown. Only downside is the very narrow parking garage, was afraid of hitting the car leaving in and out of the garage. Otherwise a great hotel for a great price! They gave chocolate chip cookies also. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds in the world; great view”
Reviews.Author: Chriswith2kidsandawife
Reviews.Content: We had driven 500 miles from mid Baja and needed a place to stop in San Diego. The Best Western and Holiday Inn were full and the Doubletree wasn't. Rooms were around $200 each per night. Our rooms were on the 16th floor, overlooking the freeway, airport and school sports field. I think they were refurbished as they were more modern looking than those pictured on this site; everything felt new and the fixtures and fittings were of a high standard. The beds were remarkably comfortable - my wife insisted I take pictures of the pillow labels so we could buy the same make on our return home! We found the service to be generally good, although it did not seem to be possible to get help with the bags (nobody turned up on both the occasions we requested help). The car park is a very tight squeeze to exit if you have a large vehicle (we were driving a Ford Expedition and just managed to get out). The bar and restaurant lacked atmosphere, although were good enough for a final drink before bedtime. There are plenty of good restaurants around and about, however, so this isn't a problem. There are a couple of stores within a 5 minute walk (down towards the sea front) along with coffee shops and a variety of restaurants (sushi, Italian, Delis, etc). You can hear the freeway clearly at night, although this was compensated by the great view of the airport, freeway and harbour. Although we live in a rural location and normally have no traffic noise at home this wasn't a bother at all. In summary, we found the Doubletree a very comfortable hotel. There are a couple of issues with service and the car park, but we would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christypix
Reviews.Content: I got a good goverment rate on this hotel ($110 on a fri) so i had to prioritize what was important to me. Obviously the price was a big deal. I have stayed at hotel solimar, hyatt, and hilton and those hotels are very nice compared to the doubletree but they are also more expensive. The location of the doubletree was a bit to far north for me. I personally like to walk out of the hotel and be directly where the action is.... but I took a cab ($5) down to the gaslamp district and when we went to the padre game the shuttle bus took us to Petco for no charge, just tip of course (they were very nice). When you enter the hotel lobby was average, small, not flashy but clean. Seems like a lot of people that stay there are there for business. There is a free shuttle to the airport and the airport isn't too far. We stayed on the six floor and the hallway we stayed at kind of smelled funny, I dont know if it use to be a smoking floor or what?.. The room was a good size, quiet, clean and had comfortable down blankets. If you are a light sleeper the airconditioning went on all night... so that humming sound might anoy you. The pool area was very nice. The pool is small with a jacuzzi. It looked like they just got new pool furniture and it had comfortable chairs and cabanas. It was pretty empty... don't expect any poolside service its not that kind of hotel. The gym was small but had all the necessities that you need to work out. The hotel was worth the money that i paid. I personally wanted something a little more fancier and closer to the gaslamp... but if you just want a clean room that is quiet, away from all the partying, close to the airport... this would be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: I believe that the prior reviews for this hotel are unduly severe. This was an excellent choice for a hotel near the airport. Room were pleasant and roomy and it is extremely convenient to the airport. Being close to the airport there is not much in the way of tourist activities by the hotel but you can walk down to the water (about eight blocks) and eat at restaurants like Anthony’s Fish Grotto. Several business associates also stayed at this hotel and all were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights. It was a good location and the room was nice and comfortable. The internet did not work for a night I was there. It was good for doing business in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for a conference and received a room on the top floor. The view from the balcony was nice but even on the top floor I could hear the noise from the nearby freeway. I did enjoy watching the planes on their takeoffs and landings. The bathroom needs better ventilation. I came out from my shower needing another shower just from sweating. There was not a lot of closet space but otherwise the room was nice and the bed very comfortable. The exercise room needs some serious upgrading. The pool area was very nice. Two computers were available in the lobby but were always occupied. The free shuttle to and from the airport was convenient and I did not have a long wait. Like other posters have mentioned, the staff could do better with their customer service skills. With some improvement this hotel has the potential to be really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great views, no fridge”
Reviews.Author: poetrypartners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree during a last-minute trip to San Diego. It was a nice experience that I wish had lasted longer. Our hotel room on the 18th floor was rather small, but the decor, with its wide vertical striped wallpaper, made it seem larger. Our room faced downtown, and stepping out on the balcony, we had a great view of the skycrapers and San Diego Bay. The king-sized bed was very, very comfortable, and we had plenty of pillows. The bathroom was standard-sized for a hotel, but the ceiling was rather low, and I felt a bit claustrophobic. The shower had good water pressure, and was stocked with plenty of towels and other niceties such as lotion and two kinds of soap. More good things about the Doubletree: - friendly registration desk staff - cookie at check-in - parking is very convenient to rooms with the garage accessible from the main elevators A couple of not-so-good things: - no in-room fridge...we were surprised that there was none - lots of outside noise from airplanes and sirens I would stay at the Doubletree again. Overall, we had a good experience, and I'd like to return to check out more of the hotel -- we didn't use any of the available recreational or dining facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Facilities, Poor Hospitality, Poor Guest Assistance”
Reviews.Author: Real_Microsoftie
Reviews.Content: Bad parts...unfortunately, my stay here included: 1) a chipped bathtub with a drain that makes drumming sounds and wakes me up when others in the hotel take a shower at 5am, 2) a toilet that doesn't stop running, 3) a phone where people can't hear me, 4) a single cookie that is a brick when cooled, 5) undercooked scallops and warm rolls with dinner that are dried out, 6) no hotel info or breakfast order menu in the room, and 7) a keycard that 'demagnetized when it was near my cell phone or other credit cards' requiring a trip to the lobby to reactivate. 8) It took 1/2 hour and 2 phone calls to get an ironing board and iron 9) After trying to order breakfast for the next day on a phone that I had to yell on to be heard, I was told I needed to use the hanging breakfast menu, so, I ordered one to be put on my door (there wasn't one in the room), filled it out and rehung it, when breakfast didn't arrive the next morning, I saw that they hadn't picked up he menu even though it was out there since 8pm the night before 10) At 9am on Saturday, even though I hung a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door, I awoke to someone knocking on my door insistently. I answered the door to find the maid ready to clean the room and saying "You're checking out today, yes?" "Yes" I replied, "Checkout time is at noon." Why did they have to disturb my sleep? 11) My mother came by to visit and she scraped the side of her new car on the extremely narrow very steep ramp while exiting the garage. Worst parking situation I've seen. Any good parts? Yes....two 1) Location....You can walk to Little Italy. But, be careful walking around the general area at night. because it isn't safe. There is a park nearby for the kids. 2) Pool Cabanas...The pool cabanas were nice. Though leaving a swimsuit coverup on the table while going to the bathroom ended up with a staff member thowing it in the garbage can and no offer to fish it out when I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: LYH75
Reviews.Content: Beautifully redone from the old Radisson. Comfortable beds. Clean Rooms. Great Location. If only they spent some money on the fitness room. Only one treadmill and reclined bike works. Forget running outside with all the smoke from fires. This is California, where every one is fit and tries to be healthy. Management is less than professional. Have better interaction at the Holiday Inn. They need some training in hotel hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: htsycc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights during a conference and everything was wonderful. I hardly had any wait for the shuttle to and from the airport. The room was clean, large, and comfortable. I especially loved watching the sunset from my balconey! The staff was very kind and helpful. They were even able to get me the tiny screwdriver I needed to take my laptop apart when it broke. And they were quick about it! I used to work in a hotel on Disney property so my standards are rather high, but this hotel met them all!

Reviews.Title: “Very so-so, staff need some re-training”
Reviews.Author: doverdog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed last weekend for a wedding, and we were underwhelmed with the hotel as a whole. The staff really didn't seem to know what was happening at all, they messed up my friend's reservation, her drycleaning, and her luggage that was (or was not, according to them) delivered from the airport. I asked the 'concierge' if he knew where the shuttle would be to the wedding (something I would think he would at least be aware of, even if it was a private shuttle, since many many hotel guests were taking it) and he had absolutely no idea, and made no effort to find out for us. Another thing that bothered me about this hotel was there is no mini-fridge. It seems most hotels these days offer that, if you want to chill some water, soda, beer, etc. The pool area was nice, albeit windy. We decided that they should move the bar that is currently in the restaurant in the lobby to the 5th floor pool, because there is some great furniture up there, and it looks like it could even be a 'scene', with little cabanas, etc. But it was sort of quiet and boring in the pool area, and I think it had some potential. Overall, an okay stay, but nothing memorable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, New renovation”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week during a business trip. Very quick and easy to get to from Airport, although was slightly confusing to find initially because I thought it was still the Radisson (as was listed on all my confirmations). Close to Little Italy. Complete renovations inside, rooms very clean and nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Hotel San Diego Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1646 Front Street, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly Radisson Hotel Harbor View)
